name: Alcohol
description: A common recreational drug to forget your sorrows.
effect: The user's Con and Cr are increased by 10.
detriment: The user's Int, Ins, Ch, Dex, Ag is reduced by 5, and he takes -10 to most actions.
overdose_effect: The user makes a Con test. On a success he becomes \emph{Nauseous}, on a fail he becomes \emph{Unconscious}.

name: Liquid Armor
description: A light blue drink with a metallic taste. High quality products will have small flakes that feel terrible in the throat.
effect: After 2 combat rounds: The user gains D10 armor. Good quality product - usually sold at triple the price - will always grant 10.
detriment: The user's Ranged Base, Dex and Ag are reduced by D10.
overdose_effect: The user suffers a permanent, cumulative -5 penalty to all tests made to regenerate health.

name: Method
description: A dark grey injection with a petroleum smell.
effect: The user gains 2 armor and immediately regains D5 HP.
detriment: The user's vision gets blurry. His perception is reduced by 10 and he cannot benefit from Aim actions.
overdose_effect: The user suffers 3 stages of radiation poisoning.

name: Sunshine
description: A light powder to be rubbed into the gums. Tastes of and feels like chalk.
effect: The user appears less threatening: his Charisma is increased by 5. His opponents are not willing to attack him unprovoked.
detriment: The user does not gain damage reduction from Con.
overdose_effect: The user becomes reliant on the drug, suffering a permanent, cumulative -2 Ch.

name: Immunoblockers
description: White capsules, commonly found in any clinic.
effect: The user gains +1 to both RI and MT. Multiple uses increase the effect, not the duration.
detriment: The user's natural regeneration is reduced by 1 per dose.\\When the effect ends - and the user then surpasses his limits - he needs to take an additional dose immediately or suffer the effects associated with too many implants.

name: Morphine
description: A powder - white, brown or blue - that becomes a clear liquid for injection once heated up.
effect: The user's Restraint for the purpose of overcoming pain is increased by 30.
overdose_effect: The user permanently takes a cumulative -5 to tests to suppress or overcome pain.

name: Raze
description: A fine, light red powder that glitters in the light. Tends to cause a slight nose bleed.
overdose_effect: A random one of the user's senses becomes \emph{Impaired} from overexposure. If it is already impaired, it is completely lost.

name: Speed
description: An off-white, crystalline powder that is smoked or downed in a capsule.
effect: The user ignores penalties from exhaustion, hunger and little sleep. His Ins and his Restraint for the purpose of overcoming pain are increased by 5.
detriment: The user bleeds out and suffocates twice as fast. He also cannot take a rest.
overdose_effect: The user develops a Bane worth ~5 GP. This is to represent psychosis, paranoia or anxiety. He also permanently loses 1 Int.

name: Zone
description: A purple injection that becomes slightly clearer for a few moments when shaken.
effect: The user has an easy time focusing on a single task. Long or repetitive tasks (including e.g. marksmanship) gain a +15 bonus.
detriment: Suddenly swapping to a different task suffers -25.
overdose_effect: The user permanently becomes \emph{Impulsive}. If they already are, they take a permanent, cumulative -5 to resist their impulses.

name: Red Mist
description: A gas that kicks the body in overdrive. It's odorless, naturally colorless but usually pigmented red for detection.
effect: The user enters a Frenzy state, unless he passes a -20 Intelligence test.
detriment: \emph{(All usual detriments of the Frenzy condition)}
overdose_effect: The user develops a Bane worth ~5 GP. This is to increased potential for violence, e.g. \emph{Bloodlust}. He also permanently loses 1 Cr when not under these effects.

name: Regenerex
description: A widely available patented onco-stimulant that greatly speeds up the user's regenerative abilities. It comes in clear vials for injection into injured tissue and displays faint chemiluminescence.
effect: The user regains 2D10 HP over the duration.
detriment: The user becomes \emph{Nauseous} and suffers 2 levels of radiation poisoning.
overdose_effect: The user's appearance is worsened by one step.\\ If that is at the lowest step already, the character develops painful tumors in a randomly determined location: regardless of health he always suffers from penalties as if the location was damaged (one level each time the location was determined).

name: Lightning Bolt
description: A blue injection, that boosts the user's reaction speed massively. It is widely used by those who can afford it.
effect: The user gains +10 to all reaction tests. He can dodge or parry non-primitive ranged weapons.
detriment: The user becomes extremely slow and lethargic. He can only take one action per round for the next scene or the rest of the combat encounter.
duration: 10 combat rounds / the next scene or the rest of the combat encounter
overdose_effect: The user goes into cardiac arrest. He requires medical assistance within a number of rounds equal to his constitution or he expires.

name: Luciferium
description: A dark red powder with the smell of blood.
effect: The user's Con is increased by 10. His Restraint for the purpose of overcoming pain is increased by 10. His natural regeneration is doubled. He never starts severe bloodloss.
detriment: When the effect runs out, the user goes catatonic. 2 days later he dies, unless another dose is administered.

name: Juice
description: An injection cycle to improve the body's development.
effect: The user only pays half as much XP to increase his physical characteristics.
detriment: The user permanently loses 0.1 MT for every 100 XP he saved from this chem.

name: Static
description: A capsule cycle to improve the mind's development.
effect: The user only pays half as much XP to increase his mental characteristics.
detriment: The user permanently loses 0.1 RI for every 100 XP he saved from this chem.
